#Text=Solo Drive a 100 Foot Power Yacht
#Text=Have you wondered how to solo drive a power yacht ?
#Text=If you do n't know , then this guide will get you started in driving your new power ( engine driven ) yacht away from the dock , around the harbor , and returning it to the dock safely .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Understand the basics about yachts .
#Text=Before you actually attempt to drive the yacht , sit in the cabin a few days and practice operating the marine radio and other communications and safety equipment .
#Text=Learn the proper radio frequencies for emergencies :
#Text=The International Distress frequency is 156.80Mhz
#Text=Coast Guard and Harbor Patrol 157.10Mhz
#Text=Ship to ship ( calling frequency ) 156.45Mhz
#Text=Ship to shore 156.70Mhz
#Text=Marine Operator ( to make a phone call ) 157.20Mhz .
#Text=These are just a few channels . — Check your area for the preferred channels in use .
#Text=Your VHF radio has a range of more than and a cell phone wo n't help much at sea .
#Text=Apply to the FCC ( Federal Communications Commission ) for your operator 's license , so you can operate the radios legally .
#Text=If you have more interest in ship radio try this , the website for the Commercial Radio Operator License Program .
#Text=Read about who needs what kind of license , and find information on obtaining the licenses .
#Text=Anyone who operates a boat needs to receive their " Boating Safety I.D. Card and Certificate .
